title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-7.3 - Asbestos abatement contractor daily project log
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-7.3 - Asbestos abatement contractor daily project log

State Regulations

The asbestos abatement contractor shall maintain a daily
project log of all pertinent events that occur throughout Phase II of the
asbestos project. This project log shall be updated daily throughout Phase II
by the on-site supervisor, and shall be kept on-site for the duration of Phase
II of the asbestos project. This log shall be made available upon verbal
request of the commissioner or his or her duly authorized representative. The
following list summarizes the various sections of this Part that require
entries into the daily project log by the asbestos abatement contractor
supervisor: (a) Sections
56-7.1
(d), 56-8.1
(b)(2), 56-9.2
(b)(2)
--work stoppage due to high air results. High air result(s) shall be noted
along with the time of the work cessation, results of barrier and negative air
system inspection, and a summary of any necessary repairs and the required
cleaning. (b) Section
56-7.8
(a)(4)
--manometer readings. To be documented twice per workshift. (c) Section
56-7.8
(a)(10)
--negative air system. Daily (even days without workshifts) inspection results
and any necessary repairs to be documented. (d) Section
56-7.9
(a)(3)
--HVAC system positive pressurization. Daily (even days without workshifts)
inspection and any necessary repairs to be documented. (e) Section
56-8.2
(d) --inspection of barriers. Daily (even days without workshifts) inspection
results and any necessary repairs to be documented. Inspections shall be twice
per workshift on days with scheduled work. (f) Section
56-8.2
(f) --testing of barriers and enclosures. Daily testing as per section
56-8.2
(f) and any
resulting necessary repairs to be documented. (g) Section
56-8.2
(h) --Daily
cleaning of enclosures. Cleaning to be documented daily at the end of the
workshift. (h) Section
56-8.6
(b)(2)(iv)
--intermediate completions. Results of each visual inspection and time of each
intermediate completion shall be documented by the supervisor in the daily
project log. (i) Section
56-9.1
(d) --visual inspection by project monitor prior to clearance air sampling. To be
documented in daily log by project monitor, along with supervisor. (j) Section
56-9.2
(e) --visual inspection by project monitor for regulated abatement work areas
exempt from clearance air sampling. To be documented in daily project log by
project monitor, along with supervisor. (k) Sections
56-9.3
(c), 56-10.4, 56-11.2
(f), 56-11.3
(e), 56-11.4
(d), 56-
11.5(c), 56-11.6(e), 56-11.7(d), 56-11.8(d)--final inspection. To be documented
by supervisor at completion of asbestos project and/or work area. Notes
